concept.title: Guitar Wiring Troubleshooting Overview
concept.shortdesc: Understanding common wiring problems helps you diagnose and fix issues systematically when your guitar produces weak or no sound.

conbody.p: Guitar wiring problems typically fall into three categories: faulty connections, incorrect wiring, or damaged components. A systematic troubleshooting approach saves time and prevents unnecessary component replacement.

section.title: Systematic Troubleshooting Approach
section.p: Work through potential causes in order from most common to least common. Start with simple checks like solder joint quality before moving to component replacement. This methodical approach identifies problems efficiently without wasting materials.
Testing after each fix confirms which issue caused the problem and prevents over-correction.
